questions.explanation: The condition 'sum > 5' is false, so the 'else' block executes, subtracting 5 from 'sum'.

questions.question:
Which value of 'X' satisfies the following condition?
(X > 5) && (X < 10) && (X % 2 == 0)
questions.explanation: 'X' must be even and between 5 and 10, inclusive of 6 and 8. The closest value in the options is 8.

questions.question:
What will be the output of the following code?
int x = 10;
System.out.println(x++ + ++x);
questions.explanation: 'x++' evaluates to 10, '++x' increments and evaluates to 12. The sum is 23.

questions.question:
What will be printed by the following code?
boolean flag = true;
System.out.println(flag ? "Yes" : "No");
questions.explanation: The ternary operator evaluates to 'Yes' since 'flag' is true.
'a++' evaluates to 5, '++a' increments to 7. So 'a += 5 + 7' results in 17.

questions.question:
What will be the output of the following code?
String str = null;
System.out.println(str == null ? "Empty" : str.length());
questions.explanation: The ternary operator checks if 'str == null' and evaluates to 'Empty'.

questions.question:
What is the output of the following code snippet?
int x = 10;
System.out.println((x > 5 ? x - 2 : x + 2) * 2);

Which statement is correct about the following code?
int arr[] = new int[5];
System.out.println(arr[0]);
questions.explanation: Array elements are initialized to 0 by default for integers.

questions.question:
What will be the result of this expression?
(5 + 2) * 3 / 2 % 4

Which operator has the highest precedence in the following code?
int result = 5 + 2 * 3 - 4 / 2;
questions.explanation: Multiplication (*) and division (/) have higher precedence over addition and subtraction.
